intro: Geniostoma gagnae, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Geniostoma gagnae thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
